metadata.name: Character Archetypes (Modern Literature Expansion)
metadata.description: Contemporary character archetypes adapted for fairy tales

reluctant_heroes.text: The Ordinary Person thrust into extraordinary circumstances against their will
The Imposter Syndrome Sufferer who doubts their abilities despite evidence of their gifts
The Retired Veteran called back for one last quest or mission
The Accidental Chosen One who fulfills a prophecy through coincidence rather than destiny
The Inheritance Rejector who initially refuses their birthright or legacy

complex_villains.text: The Fallen Idealist whose noble goals became corrupted by extreme methods
The Sympathetic Antagonist whose backstory explains their seemingly evil actions
The Reluctant Enforcer who carries out villainous orders while questioning their morality
The Mirror Villain who represents what the protagonist could become with different choices
The System Rather Than Person where institutional forces rather than individuals cause harm

moral_ambiguity.text: The Antihero who does right things for wrong reasons or through questionable methods
The Necessary Evil who commits terrible acts that ultimately prevent greater suffering
The Tarnished Paragon whose public virtue masks private flaws
The Ethical Shapeshifter who adapts their moral code to different situations
The Compromised Authority whose position requires betraying their principles

identity_explorers.text: The Code Switcher who presents different personas in different contexts
The Cultural Bridge who navigates between different worlds or communities
The Self-Reinventor who deliberately transforms their identity
The Heritage Seeker searching for connections to their roots or ancestry
The Identity Integrator working to reconcile conflicting aspects of themselves

technological_beings.text: The Sentient Creation who develops consciousness beyond their creator's intentions
The Human-Technology Hybrid whose enhancements raise questions about humanity
The Digital Entity trapped between virtual and physical existence
The Technological Animist who perceives spirits or consciousness in machines
The Memory Curator who preserves or manipulates digital records of the past

psychological_archetypes.text: The Unreliable Narrator whose perception of reality cannot be trusted
The Trauma Survivor whose past experiences shape their current behavior
The Projection Carrier onto whom others impose their expectations and fears
The Inner Child Embodiment representing unresolved aspects of another character
The Shadow Self who manifests repressed qualities of the protagonist

relationship_innovators.text: The Chosen Family Builder who creates meaningful bonds beyond blood relations
The Emotional Translator who helps others understand their feelings
The Boundary Setter who redefines relationship expectations
The Connection Catalyst who brings people together in unexpected ways
The Relationship Anarchist who rejects traditional power dynamics in connections
